page.title: 05HOLYWELL-PLACES OF INTEREST
page.content: The{Town Hall}with its clearly seen clock was erected to mark the coming of age of Sir Pyers Mostyn in 1867.Now all but the facade has been demolished in preparation for the new shopping precinct.{Panton Place}a terrace of 16 cottages built in 1816 and included in a list of buildings of architectural and historical interest was converted into 28 flats for aged people and a warden's flat.An award was received for this restoration work.Holywell was also proud to receive a commendation by the Civic Trust in 1968 for the modern{Plas Dewi flats.The Windmill,}a Penymaes landmark neglected for years is now in course of being restored as a private residence.The oldest exist- ing Inn is{the Feathers}which was built in 1796 and the White Horse Inn built in 1780 and converted in 1871-72 is now the Midland Bank PLC.
